metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20246 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in ImageMagick in MagickCore/resample.c. An attacker who submits a crafted file that is processed by ImageMagick could trigger undefined behavior in the form of math division by zero. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20246` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm1
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm1
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm1
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm1
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm1
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm1
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: rayveldkamp> imagemagick is in universe from focal onwards

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm1').
